metadata.title: CVE-2023-1281 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
Use After Free vulnerability in Linux kernel traffic control index filter(tcindex) allows Privilege Escalation. The imperfect hash area can beupdated while packets are traversing, which will cause a use-after-freewhen 'tcf_exts_exec()' is called with the destroyed tcf_ext. A localattacker user can use this vulnerability to elevate its privileges to root.This issue affects Linux Kernel: from 4.14 before git commitee059170b1f7e94e55fa6cadee544e176a6e59c2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1281` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-209-generic - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-209-generic - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-209-lowlatency - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1154-aws - 4.15.0-1154.167~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1163-azure - 4.15.0-1163.178~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1148-gcp - 4.15.0-1148.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1117-oracle - 4.15.0-1117.128~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1154.167~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1163.178~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1148.164~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1117.128~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
